request.description:
### Delete Blog Post

This endpoint is used to delete a specific blog post.

#### Request

- Method: DELETE
    
- Endpoint: `{{host}}/api/blog/673cbb2dda54a400d8ebd39b`
    

#### Response

The response for this request is a JSON schema describing the structure of the response body.

``` json
{
  "success": "boolean",
  "message": "string"
}

 ```

This endpoint is used to delete a specific blog post.

#### Request

- Method: DELETE
    
- Endpoint: `{{host}}/api/blog/673cbb2dda54a400d8ebd39b`
    

#### Response

The response for this request is a JSON schema describing the structure of the response body.

This endpoint makes an HTTP GET request to retrieve a list of blogs from the server. The request does not require any parameters or request body.

### Request Body

This request does not include a request body.

### Response Body

- `success` (boolean): Indicates if the request was successful.
    
- `blogs` (object)
    
    - `data` (array): An array of blog objects, each containing the following details:
        
        - `id` (string): The unique identifier of the blog.
            
        - `title` (string): The title of the blog.
            
        - `description` (string): The description of the blog.
            
        - `slug` (string): The slug of the blog.
            
        - `published` (boolean): Indicates if the blog is published.
            
        - `publishedAt` (string): The date and time when the blog was published.
            
        - `author` (object): Details of the author of the blog.
            
            - `id` (string): The unique identifier of the author.
                
            - `name` (string): The name of the author.
                
            - `username` (string): The username of the author.
                
            - `email` (string): The email of the author.
                
        - `tags` (array): An array of tags associated with the blog, each containing:
            
            - `id` (string): The unique identifier of the tag.
                
            - `name` (string): The name of the tag.
                
        - `categories` (array): An array of categories associated with the blog, each containing:
            
            - `id` (string): The unique identifier of the category.
                
            - `name` (string): The name of the category.
                
        - `createdAt` (string): The date and time when the blog was created.
            
        - `updatedAt` (string): The date and time when the blog was last updated.
            
    - `total` (number): The total number of blogs available.
        
    - `pagination` (object): Pagination details.
        
        - `page` (number): The current page number.
            
        - `limit` (number): The limit of blogs per page.
            
        - `totalPages` (number): The total number of pages available.
            

The response provides a list of blog objects, each containing details such as title, description, author information, tags, categories, and timestamps.

### Request Body

N/A

### Response Body

- `success` (boolean): Indicates if the request was successful.
    
- `blogs` (object)
    - `data` (array): An array of blog objects.
        - `id` (string): The unique identifier of the blog.
            
        - `title` (string): The title of the blog.
            
        - `description` (string): The description of the blog.
            
        - `slug` (string): The slug of the blog.
            
        - `published` (boolean): Indicates if the blog is published.
            
        - `publishedAt` (string): The date and time when the blog was published.
            
        - `author` (object)
            - `id` (string): The unique identifier of the author.
                
            - `name` (string): The name of the author.
                
            - `username` (string): The username of the author.
                
            - `email` (string): The email of the author.
                
        - `tags` (array): An array of tag objects.
            - `id` (string): The unique identifier of the tag.
                
            - `name` (string): The name of the tag.
                
        - `categories` (array): An array of category objects.
            - `id` (string): The unique identifier of the category.
                
            - `name` (string): The name of the category.
                
        - `createdAt` (string): The date and time when the blog was created.
            
        - `updatedAt` (string): The date and time when the blog was last updated.
            
    - `total` (number): The total number of blogs available.
        
    - `pagination` (object)
        - `page` (number): The current page number.
            
        - `limit` (number): The maximum number of blogs per page.
            
        - `totalPages` (number): The total number of pages.
            

The response includes a list of blog objects, each containing details such as the title, description, author information, tags, categories, and publication status.

### Get User Details
This endpoint retrieves the details of a specific user identified by their unique ID.

#### Request Body
This request does not require a request body.

#### Response Body
- `id`: (string) The unique identifier of the user.
- `name`: (string) The name of the user.
- `email`: (string) The email address of the user.
- `status`: (string) The status of the user account.
This endpoint sends an HTTP DELETE request to the specified user resource. Upon successful deletion, the response will include a JSON schema detailing the structure of the response data.
This endpoint sends an HTTP DELETE request to the specified user resource. Upon successful deletion, the response will include a JSON schema detailing the structure of the response data.

The `POST /api/register` endpoint is used to register a new user. The request should include the user's name, email, password, username, and role in the request body.

### Request Body
- `name`: (string) The name of the user.
- `email`: (string) The email address of the user.
- `password`: (string) The password for the user's account.
- `username`: (string) The username chosen by the user.
- `role`: (string) The role of the user (e.g., admin, user).

### Response
The response of this request is a JSON schema representing the structure of the response object. The specific properties and their types will be defined in the JSON schema format.

### Change Password

This endpoint allows the user to change their password by sending a POST request to the specified URL.

#### Request Body
- `oldPassword` (string) : The user's current password.
- `newPassword` (string) : The new password that the user wants to set.

#### Response
The response will include the updated user information or a success message upon successful password change. In case of any error, appropriate error messages will be returned.

### Login API

This API endpoint is used to authenticate and login a user.

#### Request Body
- `email` (string): The email of the user.
- `password` (string): The password of the user.

Example:
```json
{
  "email": "admin@anichur.com",
  "password": "password"
}
```

#### Response
The response will include the authentication token and user information upon successful login.

### Refresh Token
This endpoint is used to refresh the access token by providing the refresh token.

#### Request Body
- `refreshToken` (string): The refresh token used to obtain a new access token.

#### Response
The response will contain the updated access token and possibly a new refresh token.

### Retrieve User Information

This endpoint is used to retrieve the user's information.

#### Request Body
This request does not require a request body.

#### Response
- `id`: (string) The unique identifier for the user.
- `name`: (string) The name of the user.
- `email`: (string) The email address of the user.
- `role`: (string) The role of the user in the system.
